intro: Spermacoce tenuior var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sandveld bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers followed by small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
